TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit ComputerPrincipal extends System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal

Docs.summary: Encapsulates principals that are computer accounts.
Initializes a new instance of the class. The Context property must be set on the object prior to calling .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The computer principal account is not persisted when it is created. To persist the account, call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public ComputerPrincipal (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and assigns it to the specified context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The computer principal account is not persisted when it is created. To save the account, call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public ComputerPrincipal (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, string samAccountName, string password, bool enabled);

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, string samAccountName, string password, bool enabled) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The SAM account name for this computer principal.
The password for this account.
A Boolean value that specifies whether the account is enabled.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class by using the specified context, SAM account name, password, and enabled value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The computer principal account is not persisted when it is created. To persist the account, call the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.Principal.Save%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult<System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal> FindByBadPasswordAttempt (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, DateTime time, System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType type);

.method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalSearchResult`1<class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal> FindByBadPasswordAttempt(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, valuetype System.DateTime time, valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.MatchType type) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A structure that is used in conjunction with the to find computers with bad password attempts.
The that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects that have had bad password attempts within the parameters specified.
Docs.returns: A that contains one or more objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The time will default to UTC. If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A structure that is used in conjunction with the to filter search results.
The that specifies the type of comparison to use in the search.
Docs.summary: Returns a collection of objects that have an expiration time within the specified date and time range.
Docs.returns: A that contains one or more objects that match the search parameters, or an empty collection if no matches are found.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The time will default to UTC. If you want to specify the time in local time, then specify the <xref:System.DateTime.Kind%2A> property of the `time` object as <xref:DateTimeKind.Local>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal FindByIdentity (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, string identityValue);

.method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal FindByIdentity(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, string identityValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
The identity of the computer. This parameter can be any format that is contained in the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Returns a computer principal object that matches the specified identity value.
Docs.returns: A object that matches the specified identity value, or null if no matches are found.
Docs.exception: Multiple computer principal objects matching the current computer object were found.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal FindByIdentity (System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType identityType, string identityValue);

.method public static hidebysig class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ComputerPrincipal FindByIdentity(class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalContext context, valuetype System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.IdentityType identityType, string identityValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The that specifies the server or domain against which operations are performed.
A enumeration value that specifies the format of the identityValue parameter.
The identity of the computer. This parameter can be any format that is contained in the enumeration.
Docs.summary: Returns a computer principal object that matches the specified identity type and value. This version of the method determines the format of the identity value.
Docs.returns: A object that matches the specified identity value and type, or null if no matches are found.
Docs.exception: Multiple computer principal objects matching the current computer object were found.
The identity value is not a valid enumeration value.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalValueCollection<string> ServicePrincipalNames { get; }
.property instance class System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.PrincipalValueCollection`1<string> ServicePrincipalNames

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the Service Principal Names (SPN) for the computer account.
Docs.value: A collection of SPNs that specify the names of the accounts registered for this computer. The syntax for the SPN depends on the underlying store.
